results.title: The Story of the Southern Cross: an Australian Aboriginal legend
results.creator_credit: Concept Films of Australia, Pilgrim Films and Thelma Dufton
results.brief_description: Using drawings, tells the story of the origin of the Southern Cross. Adapted from an Aboriginal legend by Marcia Hatfield. Narration by Ron Haddrick.

results.title: The Story of the soil
results.creator_credit: Morrow Productions and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The story of the soil from the beginning of earth. How human interference with the partnership between the soil and vegetation has reduced many areas to desolation. Emphasises the need to restore nature’s harmony between climate, soil, plants, animals, and humans.

results.title: The Story of the Snowy Scheme
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Authority
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of the Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Scheme. Ultimately the Scheme will double Australia’s present power output and will provide ample irrigation water each year. Excavatgions are in progress for miles of tunnel which will divert the waters of the Snowy into the Murray, Murrumbidgee and Tumut Rivers. Maps and diagrams as well as photographs show what has been achieved. The Munyong Power Station was officially opened by the Prime Minister in 1955. The completed Guthega Dam supplies this station with water.

results.title: The Story of the six winged lions
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam looks at a Chinese plate. The picture shows somone big, helped by six winged lions, to bully a smaller person. Sam decides to use the power of the magic ball, and do something about it.

results.title: The Story of the serials
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Excerpts from famous silent serials - including “The Perils of Pauline” and even earlier productions - succeed in recapturing the atmosphere of those early thrillers. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: The Story of the pirates
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Presents a fantasy about a boy who is transported to the high seas by a magic ball. Shows how he joins with an old fisherman in foiling the attempts of a group of pirates to bury their treasure. For primary grades.

results.title: The Story of the Olympics
results.creator_credit: Derek Conrad and Conrad Television Associates
results.brief_description: This video will delight anyone with a love of sport or a general interest in the history of one of the world’s greatest sporting events. From as early as the first Olympic marathon which was won, appropriately enough by a Greek water-carrier, to as recent as the Seoul 1988, when the return of the Russians pushed the United States into third place and the drugs issue made headlines a Ben Johnson was stripped of his medal, you can relive the triumph and the heartache that have combined to make the Olympics the inspiration that they are today.

results.title: The Story of the letter post
results.creator_credit: Oswald Skilbeck, General Post Office and David Morphet
results.brief_description: this film recounts the gradual development of the British mail service from the fifteenth century, reconstructed with period costumes, museum pieces, and old stamps. Early use of messengers and Henry VIII’s service expanded for public use by Charles I; 1660 Act of Parliament; Ralph Allan’s reforms; the Industrial Revolution; improved roads and the mail coach; Rowland Hill’s penny post and modern mechanical methods.

results.title: The Story of the Kelly gang (1906)
results.creator_credit: Nevin Tait, John Tait and Charles Tait
results.brief_description: Featuring highlights from the bushranging career of the Kelly brothers, this 1906 film openly presents the Kelly’s as gallant heroes, with the police as the enemy, and makes no attempt to apologise for the cheerful celebration of outlawry. In the spirit of myth making, the film refrains from humiliating Ned by showing his execution (an obligatory display of a just reward in later films) and the film closes on a note of sadness with his capture by the police. Cast includes Elizabeth Tait, John Tait.

results.title: The Story of the grandfather clock
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam noticed that the grandfather clock had stopped. The magic ball made him very small and he went through the keyhole of the clock. There he saw people.
